name: Rabih Jreish
address: 3rd Floor, Sbeity Business Center, Gallery Semaan Street
bio:
In 2015, Mobile Arts was the first company in the MENA region, to release the first mVAS application in UAE through DCB, when it was officially announced by Etisalat as the first operator to start DCB in the region. 

Since then, Mobile Arts expanded its own inhouse monetization solutions for the VAS mobile ecosystem, to be what it is today, a leading Technology Service Provider that processed over 70 million conversions offering carrier billing master aggregators, operators, advertising networks, media buyers, publishers, and content providers its turnkey platform solution aka Mobibox to achieve growth.

Mobibox solutions are developed in-house for maximum flexibility, ensuring its partners to get the most reliable service. It is available as a white label solution, enabling all mobile key players, merchants, media buyers, advertising networks, and payment providers to access to markets and grow revenues while saving time and money on development.

Mobibox features bring independence and flexibility when it comes to monetization management. Mobibox is developed as a platform as a service (PaaS) using high-end mobile technologies in user acquisition, payments, tracking and monetization to optimize best KPIs and ROI

Rabih has over 15 years’ experience in the Value-Added business, and as a business development manager he works closely with new clients for delivering Mobibox’s best practices accordingly to clients’ needs for achieving goals efficiency and access to new markets.

He also heads the expansion of Mobibox’s platform with a focus on mobile payments and the implementation of all its strategic business decisions for new partnerships with payment providers, content providers and mobile technology companies. 
He holds the degree of Master of Research specialized in Telecommunications Networks and Master in Telecommunication and Computer Engineering.

Today, MT2, known as “The School of VAS” operates physically in Lebanon, UAE, KSA, Kuwait and Bahrain, with strong partnerships to 33 Mobile Network Operators and more than 50 business & marketing associates.
 
MT2’s solutions and services cover 4 main areas across 14 countries in the emerging markets of the Middle East, Gulf and North Africa:
-  Mobile Payment
-  Mobile Advertising
-  MT2 API Platform
-  Content & Aggregation

Our HQ is London based and we have seamlessly adapted to the new normal of working from any location during the pandemic.  I'm happy to meet in London while we still can but very much looking forward to all the events to come in 2021.  

Chat to me about your mobile billing expansion.

#DCB #PSMS #PFI #OBS #SDP #2clickFlows

name: Nashar Sally
bio:
MessageCloud 

As a Tier One aggregator, we have direct connections to mobile operators around the globe. The result is exceptional cost-efficiency – and that means savings we can pass on to our customers. This network also creates a fast, seamless and consistent service, wherever in the world your customers might be. In addition to being a  multi-award-winning mobile messaging provider, we offer products to analyse phone numbers, verify users and accept payments by mobile.

MessageCloud Products:

Pay - Accept customer payments securely through carrier billing or SMS billing

Send - Fast, reliable SMS messaging with global reach on our powerful cloud-based platform

Verify- Authenticate customer logins and processes by SMS for secure mobile transactions

Numbers - Receive SMS messages via your own virtual mobile number or shortcode

Analyse - Access detailed data about any number worldwide with our HLR Lookup service


www.messagecloud.com

name: Rupen Patel
bio:
Industry veteran Rupen Patel has joined Dynamic Mobile Billing (DMB) as head of sales and marketing from Three UK.

Patel brings a wealth of experience from his time as Product & Lead Commercial Manager at mobile operator Three UK, as well as previous industry experience gained at Telefónica and Mobile Ecosystem Forum (MEF).

DMB CEO Kev Dawson comments on the appointment: “Rupen joins the UK Management team at an exciting growth time for the business.  We are seeing new revenue growth opportunities across both existing and new sector clients and Rupen offers extensive experience and capability to help drive DMB UK offerings in these areas.”

Patel adds: “I’m delighted to be joining DMB at this promising time and hoping my experience can directly contribute to the mutual success of both myself and the business.”

Patel started his 20+ year career in the Media & Advertising sector, including stints at ITV, Channel 4 and WPP covering Sales, Business Development and Account/Client/Product Management.  He’s worked across all the major Media Agency groups and managed a portfolio of clients that included BT, Vodafone, Unilever, Mars, Procter & Gamble and GlaxoSmithKlein.

At Three UK, Patel was initially hired within the Payment Services team and was responsible for managing both Direct Carrier Billing & Premium Rate Services. For the last 20 months his focus has been solely on managing and growing the Premium SMS and Voice business working within the Wholesale Team.

bio:
CEO of Avatar World Group. Since 2004 monetizing digital services. 
AWG is the LATAM leader in Direct Carrier Billing and a key partner for telecom operators specialized in customer retention and maximizing ARPU. 
With +100 team members we our proud to be named a Great Place to Work.

AWG operates in the following countries: 
Latam: Argentina, Brazil, Uruguay, Paraguay, Perú, Bolivia, México, Colombia, Chile, Dominican Republic, Haiti, El Salvador, Guatemala, Nicaragua, Honduras and Pamana, 
Africa: South Africa, Ghana, Malawi and Nigeria.

As a Tech entrepreneur I began riding this rollercoaster adventure in 2004 at the age of 22 in the Wireless industry, when I created with my partner a company that provides mobile entertainment content and mobile marketing services. Our branded content was the first of its kind in Argentina.

During these last 15 years, I've kept on specializing in the mobile ecosystem and founded and invested in several tech sector companies.

name: Manuel Dominguez Sarmiento
address: Av. Juan B. Justo 1463 Piso 2 Oficina 3, Ciudad Autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
bio:
Since an early age, I have always been motivated to build things from scratch. I started with LEGO bricks and never looked back. I went on to begin and complete several projects as I grew older, from early childhood up until my late teenage years: an indie technology magazine; a shareware software development house; dabbled in hobby electronics, digital art and video editing; and even independently recorded and released an album with my very own alternative rock band.

So I became an Engineer (IT Engineer to be more precise), which perfectly fit my natural inclinations and gave me many invaluable tools to answer the most basic (but sometimes the most difficult) question: How do we do THAT? (whatever THAT may be).

Once my studies were over I decided to take on a difficult but exciting challenge: to build my own mobile entertainment company. Ever since then I've been passionately involved in all aspects of setting up, running and growing our company into one of the major mobile entertainment players in our market.

From day one, our focus has been on building mobile services centered on the customer experience. We strive to offer innovative value added features to engage our users for the long term, based on detailed market and user behavior research and analysis.

We have very ambitious plans for the near term. We have a great team, and we're ready to take on any new challenges and opportunities coming our way.

Specialties: Team coordination, Technology advisor, Systems architecture, Market analysis, Business Intelligence, End-user service design and deployment, Media planning

name: Anastasiia Bilous
bio:
Anastasiia Bilous, COO, handles the overall management of NMS and the implementation of all its strategic business decisions focused within the online entertainment and dating industry globally.

Anastasiia has been with the company for three years. Prior to that, she spent almost 10 years managing as COO an international asset management firm with the HQ in Menlo Park, USA with the main focus on the projects in the next industries: SocialComm & Messengers, Dating & Biz Networking, B2B Management Tools, MedTech.

Anastasiia Bilous graduated from Braunschweig Technical University, Germany with a B.A. in Business Administration. She is a proud Partner at Startup Networks Switzerland. She also serves as an Advisor in Machine Learning powered project “Bicovery” for Bipolar people for the last two years.

In her spare time Anastasiia is a speaker at International events, leads her columns in major IT news sites in the world and busy with fundraising for the Ukrainian animal shelter “FRIEND”.

Anastasiia is a strong believer that it’s crucial to keep asking right questions and to look for simple answers/solutions to them

Anastasiia works with each client and each partner as with her own business and thus delivering a strong product, approaching marketing & sales with the best value for it’s money and deep data & financial analysis is the priority #1.

name: Jarvis Todd
address: Virginia Cottage, Nash Lane, Scaynes Hill, West Sussex
bio:
The Telemedia industry has pioneered the concept of revenue sharing on billable network traffic generated through consumer responses and interactions with identifiable media and marketing sources. This is now widely understood to be the best commercial model for interactive digital services or value added services (VAS) and also provides the mechanism whereby premium content and mobile applications can be monetised. Jarvis has been involved with exclusively providing business media services to this global Telemedia industry since 1995. 

Having graduated from the University of London, he was initially appointed Sales Director for Europe Media Ltd, progressing to a full board role and eventually becoming the owner and CEO of World Telemedia Ltd when the business was acquired from CMP in 1998. 

Jarvis and his team now produce a successful programme of internationally acclaimed World Telemedia events along with “pop up” projects such as #unofficialMWC2020. Publishing activities include, Telemedia Magazine (printed each quarter), Telemedia News (bi monthly digital) and Telemedia Viewpoint – a webinar and video content service that’s hosted on their leading news and information portal - TelemediaOnline.co.uk. 

In 2020 the Myth Buster series of white papers was added to the portfolio; with the specific aim of making the case for deploying carrier billing and related engagement technologies across twelve key vertical market sectors. More recently Jarvis has been committed to championing the telemedia industry across LinkedIn and now regularly attracts over 20,000 views per week from his posts.

name: Chantale Batanian
bio: Over 9 Years of Experience in Telecommunications and VAS industry focused on MENA region.

name: Philippe Beliaeff
bio: Philippe has two decades of experience in the Telecommunications and Media industry. After starting his carrier in Telcos, he created his own consulting company. He successfully conducted his company in a series of mergers followed by an IPO on the Paris stock market in 2000. Philippe joined the Atlas Group in 2003. He joined the Atlas Interactive team in 2006 and has since then strongly contributed to Atlas Interactive business growth.

name: Paul Skeldon
bio: Paul is a telecoms journalist and author, specialising in all things mobile. He is managing editor of M-Retailing, the leading online news source for the retail industry published by Internet Retailing. He is also managing editor of Telemedia-news.com, the leading news service for the value-added telecoms market globally, managing editor and co-creator of interactive ‘webizine’ Mobiledotcomms. He has also just launched The Mobile View, a video based mobile industry insight website which went live in February 2014. He is a regular contributor on mobile comms to The Wall Street Journal Europe, Internet Retailing magazine, Telemedia magazine, Banking Technology and T360. His first book – ‘M-commerce’ – was published by Crimson Business Publishing in November 2011. He is also managing director of video and podcasting company, Videobaby Media, and has worked with numerous brands and publishers to produce video and audio content. Paul lives with his small son, two cats, five iPhones, three iPads, five laptops, a dongle and a garage full of mobile handsets dating back to 1992 in the Chilterns in Buckinghamshire, UK.

name: Valentina Tranquilli
bio:
Valentina Tranquilli is a passionate entrepreneur, Co-Founder of Cookies Factory, a leading company in the digital entertainment and advertising sectors.
With a 15 years’experience in the telco industry, she led Marketing and Operations teams working on Digital Advertising and Mobile Payments projects in Europe, LatAm, Japan, MeNa.
She founded from scratch Cookies Factory, an international company focused on digital entertainment services and performance marketing with its brand “Cookies Digital”.
Cookies Digital runs advertising campaigns worldwide to acquire high quality users for premium contents and for any digital product charged especially via mobile payment solutions.
The company, active in +17 countries worldwide, has been listed for 2 years in a row (2020 and 2021) by the Financial Times and Statista as one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe.
Valentina is now COO of the group and investor in several companies in Europe.
She is also a board member of Opticks, a technology company focused on fraud detection and online traffic monitoring for digital advertisers.
Valentina is now based in Rome, as Cookies is, but you can often find her travelling between Dubai and her beloved Japan. 
She likes playing soccer every week, videogames and walking in Japan.

name: Ivan Dumancic
bio: Carrier billing and CPaaS platforms expert. We are a direct advertiser with in house mobile content offers in 30 geos. Looking for carrier billing solutions and other opportunities.

name: Ovidio Sanchez Rodriguez
bio:
The most appropriate keywords to define myself are: Innovation ; Creativity ; Strategy ; Planning ; Project Management ; Marketing ; Training ; Performance Management ; Product Management ; Monetization 
DIMOCO is a leading payment and messaging innovator. As industry leader at the cutting edge of mobile technology it has paved the way in direct carrier billing and mobile messaging services. DIMOCO stimulates the creation of new payment and messaging services with the FinTech philosophy at its core. The group is trusted by global telecom carriers, card schemes, content publishers, large merchants and corporations.

name: Kevin Dawson
bio:
We are a global provider of billing and mobile payment solutions with local operations around the World. 

DMB has been at the forefront of the mobile payments industry since its inception. 

We are fully compliant with the latest industry regulations and standards, and working with us gives merchants direct connections to all the major carriers in UK, Ireland, Australia and various African territories.

name: Gavin Dent
bio: Gavin was part of the core team which produced the first T-Mobile internet portal in 2000. Between 2005 and 2010 Gavin headed up the VAS and DCB Payments business at T-Mobile. During this time he managed the early rapid growth of the sector, and contributed to the creation of Payforit scheme. In 2011 Gavin co-founded Empello, who is the leading provider of Anti-fraud solutions for operators, merchants and aggregators. Empello has offices in London, Dubai and Sao Paulo, backed by an additional operations team in Asia.
